Event.name: Response
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> performs a <fen>Response</fen> action in consequence of a <fen>Trigger</fen> event. In many cases, a non-agentive <fen>Responding_entity</fen> causes the <fen>Response</fen> after the <fen>Trigger</fen> occurs.
<ex><fex name="Agent">I</fex> <t>respond</t> <fex name="Trigger">to earthquakes</fex> <fex name="Response">by hiding under my desk</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Response
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The means action whereby the <fen>Agent</fen> responds to the Trigger.
<ex>The diocese <t>responded</t> <fex name="res">by taking the property</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Responding_entity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A non-agentive entity that is impinged upon by a <fen>Trigger</fen> event to which they respond.
<ex><fex name="res_e">This plastic</fex> <t>responds</t> well to pressure.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Trigger
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An event that impinges upon the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Responding_entity</fen> and produces a <fen>Response</fen> from it.
<ex> How has the modern welfare state <t>responded</t> <fex name="tri">to the needs of working class women</fex>, and why? </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The point in time when the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Responding_entity</fen> manifests its <fen>Response</fen> to the <fen>Trigger</fen> . <ex>Israel <t>responded</t> <fex name="Time">yesterday</fex> to the killing of 22 people by Palestinian suicide bombers with a helicopter attack</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A characterization of the <fen>Responding_entity</fen>, <fen>Agent</fen>, or their <fen>Response</fen> action.
<ex>The government agencies <t>responded</t> <fex name="man">slowly</fex> and without much effort.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Response</fen> action takes place.
<ex>The auto industry has <t>responded</t> <fex name="Place">in the U.S., but particularly in Asian and European markets</fex> by manufacturing an entry-level segment of cars that is more appealing, better looking, and safer than in the past.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>An action that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to accomplish by performing the <fen>Response</fen> action.</def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The intentional <fen>Agent</fen> that is impinged upon by a <fen>Trigger</fen> event to which they respond.
<ex>Once again <fex name="age">the Government</fex> is <t>responding</t> to a crisis with measures that will only harm patients</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Dimension
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A particular feature of the <fen>Responding_entity</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> that is involved in the <fen>Response</fen> action.
<ex>Don't respond emotionally, <t>respond</t> <fex name="dim">rationally</fex>.</ex>
<ex>The body's <fex name="dim">immune</fex> <t>response</t> to this agent is particularly extreme.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Role
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The capacity of of the <fen>Agent</fen> is their <fen>Response</fen> act.
<ex>His <t>response</t> <fex name="rol">as an official</fex> was quite off-putting.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: respond.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: do something as a reaction to

lexUnit.name: react.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: respond to something in a particular way or with particular behaviour

lexUnit.name: reaction.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an instance of reacting to or against something.

lexUnit.name: act (on).v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (with on/upon) to take notice of and react to.
